title: Counting begins in Kurdish independence vote
description:
(25 Sep 2017) Polls have closed across Iraq's Kurdish region and in disputed territories where residents cast ballots in a referendum on support for independence, according to local television broadcasts.
The vote is not binding and is not expected to result in independence any time soon, but was hailed as historic by Kurdish leaders spearheading the campaign.
Initial official results are expected on Tuesday.
Both Baghdad and Ankara have spoken out against the referendum.
Earlier on Monday, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan threatened military intervention in Iraq in response to the vote, stressing that Kurdish independence was unacceptable to his country.
